channel.title: Is it possible for CFG files to mess with your runserver.bat?
channel.description:
I posted something similar to this earlier, and this kept on happening.
[img]http://i41.tinypic.com/16jgqu.png[/img]
But as I played around with it to see what was wrong, my only conclusion was the .CFG files, because I had the original source (before any editing) and just copied and pasted the original .CFG and then it worked fine, then i did the same to the new updated .CFG files, and then it worked, So is it possible it could be the .CFG files messing it with the runserver.bat? And if so, what could be wrong? and how could I fix this?
Thanks for any help :)
-icp again.

item.title: Is it possible for CFG files to mess with your runserver.bat?

@icp_again wrote:

Yeah, I just edited that…

item.title: Is it possible for CFG files to mess with your runserver.bat?
item.dc:creator: @icp_again icp again
item.description:
@icp_again wrote:

myspaceman123:

looks like antileech =()

Umm…Anti-Leech? Lol I’m so new to these terms.

jc22493:

I’m not sure why that error occurs, but in general, using spaces instead of tabs in a configuration file will cause an error while running the server.

Oh dude I need to check that!

checking

No Effing way…I fucking love you, (lol) that did it, how in the hell did I not see that?? (it was just one space) after the autospawn

spawn = 494 space tab location etc

Thank you soooo much! + rep!

Damn mopar… I need 15 rep to rep you, but if I had 15 rep I would rep you.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible for CFG files to mess with your runserver.bat?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493

@jc22493 wrote:

I’m not sure why that error occurs, but in general, using spaces instead of tabs in a configuration file will cause an error while running the server.
